meta.content: Taylor Independent School District has seven schools in its district in Taylor, TX.

div.div: Relentless in the pursuit of educational excellence

article.aria-label: Teacher Work Day / Student Holiday (Legacy Only)

h3.a: Teacher Work Day / Student Holiday (Legacy Only)

article.aria-label: Teacher Work Day / Student Holiday (Legacy Only)

h3.a: Teacher Work Day / Student Holiday (Legacy Only)

div.div: Taylor ISD is offering opportunities for secondary students to earn credit in academic subjects and for elementary students to accelerate a grade level by passing the appropriate examinations for acceleration. Please see the attached announcement and request forms for more information.

article.aria-label: Superintendent Brown Encourages Cloth Face Coverings

h3.a: Superintendent Brown Encourages Cloth Face Coverings

div.div: Taylor ISD Superintendent Keith Brown encourages everyone to wear a cloth face covering to slow the spread of COVID-19. Suggestions for making your own covering are included here.

img.alt: Superintendent Brown Encourages Cloth Face Coverings Featured Photo

article.aria-label: Main Street Lunch/Assignment Pick-up Procedure Change

h3.a: Main Street Lunch/Assignment Pick-up Procedure Change

div.div: To prevent the line of cars from backing-up onto Main Street during lunch/assignment pick-up from 11:00am – 12:30pm, all traffic will now enter through the MSI parent pick-up entrance on T. H. Johnson Drive. Just follow the signs around MSI to pick-up assignments at the Central Admin entrance, and then to pick up meals in front of the event center.

article.aria-label: Taylor ISD to remain Closed/Instructing through May 4, 2020

h3.a: Taylor ISD to remain Closed/Instructing through May 4, 2020

div.div:
In response to Governor Abbott’s orders, TAYLOR ISD will extend the suspension of normal district operations through Monday, May 4th in an effort to support our nation’s need to slow the spread of the novel coronavirus, or COVID-19.
Taylor ISD will continue to feed anyone 18 years old or younger at our designated feeding sites. We will continue to maintain our “Closed, Instructing” operation status.
April 3, 2020: Please see the enclosed letter (English and Spanish) from Dr. George Willey, Chief Academic Officer, regarding instructional continuity during the coronavirus crisis.

To reduce the number of trips families are making to pick up meals, the following changes will be made starting Monday April 6th at the Main Street Event Center "drive through" location and at our mobile stops.
"Taylor ISD is preparing every student to compete in a global society through a premium educational experience and strong partnerships."
"Taylor ISD will be the district of choice as we pursue educational excellence."
